meanings.definition: An explosion of a bomb on or slightly above the ground.
meanings.sent2: The military planned a groundburst to test the impact.
meanings.sent3: The groundburst startled the birds from their nests.
meanings.sent4: The groundburst painted the sky with fiery colors.
meanings.sent5: The groundburst left a smoking crater in its wake.

meanings.definition: To explode on or slightly above the ground.
meanings.sent1: The bomb will groundburst upon impact.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks groundburst in a dazzling display.
meanings.sent3: The children cheered as the firework groundburst lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent4: The volcano seemed to groundburst with molten lava.
meanings.sent5: The balloon groundburst with a loud pop.
